intro: Securinega abeggii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. The plant produces a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin.
